TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and resident in GPE .
He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE , ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätt ) convicted the applicant , inter alia , of an aggravated drug offence and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The time for appeal expired on DATE . The applicant 's appeal was entry stamped on DATE at the registry of ORG . On DATE ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätt ) decided to dismiss the appeal as being out of time .

The applicant sought leave to appeal from ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) . He claimed that he had posted the appeal to the post - office box address of ORG on DATE by first class mail . ORG had informed the public that the post sent by first class would get to the recipient DATE . The applicant also claimed that ORG post - office box should have been emptied at the end of office hours . He , therefore , alleged that either there had been a delay in the post or ORG officials had not emptied the box duly . He claimed that since his appeal had arrived out of time because of negligence of some public officials , it should have been examined . On DATE ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal .

According to LAW , LAW , LAW , of LAW ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalken ) , the time - limit for filing an appeal against a ORG judgment is DATE from the judgment . According to LAW , the appeal must be delivered to the registry of ORG no later than on DATE of the time for appeal .

SectionCARDINAL , Subsection CARDINAL , of LAW to the Courts ( laki eräiden asiakirjain lähettämisestä tuomioistuimille , lag om insändande av vissa handlingar till domstolar , CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provides that appeals may be sent by post at the appellant 's own risk . According to LAW , a document sent by post is considered to have arrived when it has been delivered to the recipient .
